desc: This seminar provides an introduction to psychology that focuses on psychological issues related to moral behavior. The course examines the nature of those states of mind that are thought to constitute moral (or evil) character and produce moral (or evil) actions, relationships, and societies. States considered may include humility, self-respect, beneficence, compassion, caring, anger, forgiveness, courage, and truthfulness. Open to first-year students and sophomores only. Offered every year.
name: Moral Psychology
notes: Open to Sophomores and First-Year Students only.
